intro: Gratiola ebracteata, commonly known as the slender yellowroot, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Its root system is fibrous and contains compounds that have been traditionally used in herbal medicine. Gratiola ebracteata is also noted for its delicate, aromatic foliage and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
